required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of ARO-AAT in Normal Adult Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Single and Multiple Dose-Escalating Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Effect of ARO-AAT on Serum Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Levels in Normal Adult Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of single- and multiple-ascending doses of ARO-AAT in healthy adult volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Possibly or Probably Related to Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (single-ascending dose [SAD] phase): up to 29 (+/- 2) days post-dose; Part B (multiple-ascending dose [MAD] phase): up to 113 (+/- 2) days post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) of ARO-AAT: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (single-ascending dose [SAD] phase): up to 48 hours post-dose; Part B (multiple-ascending dose [MAD] phase): up to 48 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (SAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose; Part B (MAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Terminal Elimination Half-Life (tÂ½)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (SAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose; Part B (MAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Zero to 24 Hours (AUC0-24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (SAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose; Part B (MAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Zero to Infinity (AUCinf)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (SAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose; Part B (MAD phase): up to 48 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Serum Alpha-1 Antitrypsin (AAT) Levels From Day 1 Pre-Dose Baseline to Nadir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (SAD phase): up to 29 (+/- 2) days; Part B (MAD phase): up to 113 (+/- 2) days

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response of Serum AAT levels From Nadir Back to Above 20% of Baseline or Above 90 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A (SAD phase): up to 29 (+/- 2) days; Part B (MAD phase): up to 113 (+/- 2) days

intervention.description: Single or multiple doses of ARO-AAT by subcutaneous (sc) injections
Calculated volume to match active comparator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women of child bearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test, cannot be breastfeeding, and must be willing to use contraception
- Willing to provide written informed consent and to comply with study requirements
- Non-smoker for at least one year
- Normal lung function
- No abnormal finding of clinical relevance at Screening
- Normal AAT level at Screening visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant health concerns
- Regular use of alcohol within one month prior to Screening
- Use of an investigational agent or device within 30 days prior to dosing or current participation in an investigational study
- Recent use of illicit drugs
- Use of any drugs or dietary/herbal supplements know to interfere with liver metabolism
NOTE: additional inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply, per protocol
